name: GetTransactionalMessageDeliveries
description:
Fetch delivery details for transactional messages.

Retrieve information about individual message deliveries from a transactional message. Use optional parameters to specify a time range for the message data, otherwise, data from the last 6 months is returned by default.

parameters.name: transactional_message_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the transactional message, found in the UI or URL, e.g., '/transactional/3/templates/139' where the ID is 3.

value_schema.description: The identifier of your transactional message. You'll find this in the UI or URL of your transactional message. For example, if this is the path of a transactional message URL - `/transactional/3/templates/139` - the `transactional_id` is 3.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Specify the token for the page of results you want to return. Use the `next` property from previous responses as the value to paginate.

value_schema.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per page, as an integer.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: return_metrics
parameters.description: Specify one or more metrics to return, such as 'sent', 'delivered', or 'clicked'.

value_schema.description: Determines the metric(s) you want to return.

parameters.name: broadcast_state
parameters.description: Specifies the state of the broadcast to filter results. Options are 'failed', 'sent', 'drafted', or 'attempted'.

parameters.name: beginning_timestamp
parameters.description: The start time for the query, specified as a Unix timestamp. Limits the query to data starting from this time.

value_schema.description: The beginning timestamp for your query.

parameters.name: query_ending_timestamp
parameters.description: The ending timestamp for the query, determining the end of the time range for message data retrieval.

value_schema.description: The ending timestamp for your query.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Customer.io App API

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

value_schema.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: Determines the metric(s) you want to return.

value_schema.description: Determines the metric(s) you want to return.

parameters.name: start_ts
parameters.description: The beginning timestamp for your query.

value_schema.description: The beginning timestamp for your query.

parameters.name: end_ts
parameters.description: The ending timestamp for your query.

value_schema.description: The ending timestamp for your query.

parameters.name: transactional_id
parameters.description: The identifier of your transactional message. You'll find this in the UI or URL of your transactional message. For example, if this is the path of a transactional message URL - `/transactional/3/templates/139` - the `transactional_id` is 3.

value_schema.description: The identifier of your transactional message. You'll find this in the UI or URL of your transactional message. For example, if this is the path of a transactional message URL - `/transactional/3/templates/139` - the `transactional_id` is 3.
